title: 50% winrate
body:
Is it just me or am I being force to get 50% winrate? 
When I go on a win streak you can bet I'm going on a lose streak the next few games. 
Yes I know, some games can be won... but most of the time I feel like the other players on my team aren't in the rank that I am.

replies.body:
It does... in a way. 

The more you win, the harder your opponents become. This is so you have a fair match most games are not destroying people who are no where near as skilled as you.

Therefore eventually you'll reach the tipping point where the opponents get harder and harder until they are as good as you. When your opponents are equally as skilled as you. Then you will have a 50/50 chance of winning in the long run.

The fact that most win rates hover around 50% is actually a testimate to how good their matchmaking system is.

> The fact that most win rates hover around 50% is actually a testimate to how good their matchmaking system is.

People say that if you can't carry you belong there, but I'm sick and tired of teammates who go 0/10 and then blame each other for being equally as dumb.

It's just a [negativity bias](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Negativity_bias). The enemy team has team mates that go 0/10 and blame each other just as often as you do.

Almost everyone feels like their teams are holding them back, myself included. Mathematically though that's impossible. 

Anyway long story short unless you're literally the unluckiest person on the planet, You'll reach your actual rank within 100-200 games max. From there you will steadily see your winrate decrease to around 50%. So the best thing you can do to climb if you're become stagnant and are really serious about climbing is practice and try and improve.

Something important to remember is that winrate does not represent your skill. Just your ability to climb at the elo you're currently at.

A majority of players find themselves hovering around a 50% win-rate, even the pros!! It's not intentional, it's just the way wins and losses equal out over time. I find the same thing happening to me, and most of the time it's due to my own overconfidence. 

I start doing really well, and then in the next match I'm more relaxed coming off of my last win, so my reflexes aren't up to snuff. Focus on making every game count, as if it was the first one of the day, and you might see that win-rate get a bit higher!
Yes, I did vote for the second choice.
